metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5740 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
"deny-answer-aliases" is a little-used feature intended to help recursiveserver operators protect end users against DNS rebinding attacks, apotential method of circumventing the security model used by clientbrowsers. However, a defect in this feature makes it easy, when the featureis in use, to experience an assertion failure in name.c. Affects BIND9.7.0->9.8.8, 9.9.0->9.9.13, 9.10.0->9.10.8, 9.11.0->9.11.4,9.12.0->9.12.2, 9.13.0->9.13.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5740` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.18').
